data.text:
The national bidding network system has been upgraded and added many new functions

On April 26, 4, Circular No. 2024/06/TT-BKHDT (Circular 2024) guides the provision and posting of information on contractor selection and bidding document templates on the National Bidding Network System. The system (system) is officially issued and takes effect. Accordingly, the system continues to upgrade functions to meet the new bidding form specified in this Circular. From the effective date of the Circular, organizations participating in the system should note that when selecting contractors on the system, they must comply with regulations.

The system adds new flows and functions

First, according to the provisions of Circular 06 on the scope of bidding packages requiring online bidding, the system has quickly been completed, adding online bidding flows for 4 cases, including: Procurement of goods in the form of centralized procurement applies contractor selection based on supply ability; Non-consulting service bidding package is divided into many parts (lots); Construction and installation bidding packages apply contract type based on output results; Non-consulting bidding packages apply time-based contracts. Thus, the system has completed the functions for most bidding packages that can be bid online, thereby increasing competition, fairness, and transparency in bidding activities.

Second, the system adds additional contractors who are allowed to register to participate and participate in bidding on the System. Accordingly, the system allows contractors that are individuals, groups of individuals to bid on their innovative products, and creative start-up businesses to participate in online bidding for bidding packages in the field of goods and non-private sectors. question.

Third, with the goal of improving transparency in bidding activities, the system has quickly completed the function of allowing investors to publicly disclose key information of the contract. According to the provisions of the Bidding Law (Clause 4, Article 8) and detailed instructions in Circular 06 (Article 11), the Investor will have to disclose this information no later than 5 working days from the effective date of the contract. .

Units need to pay special attention to transitional provisions

The transition period is a sensitive period, users need to pay attention to the regulations and instructions that have been issued to ensure proper implementation of the law, avoiding affecting the contractor selection organization plan of the company. unit. Specifically:

For bidding packages that have issued e-HSMT/e-HSMST/e-HSMQT before the effective date of Circular 06 (April 26, 4), the Investor/Bid Procuring Entity (BMT) unit continues to organize Select contractors online according to the provisions of Circular No. 2024/01/TT-BKHDT and contractors will still participate in bidding according to the forms of this e-HSMT/e-HSMST/e-HSMQT, which require Note the prescribed forms on bid guarantees.

Cases where e-HSMT/e-HSMST/e-HSMQT has not yet been issued on the effective date of Circular 06 (April 26, 4) (including cases approved but not yet released on the system), The BMT must prepare, amend, and re-approve in accordance with the provisions of Circular 2024 and issue the revised e-HSMT/e-HSMST/e-HSMQT on the system and the participating bidders submit their bids according to the following procedures: this new form. During the bidding process, contractors should note important forms such as Form No. 06a - Bid Guarantee (For independent contractors), Form No. 4b - Bid Guarantee (for joint venture contractors). ), Form No. 4 – Joint venture agreement.

Additional functions for investors to meet Decree 24

In addition to updating the forms, the system also completes and adds functions to help investors publicize the list of contractors whose reputation is assessed in participating in bidding according to the provisions of Clause 1, Article 18 of Decree No. 24. /2024/ND-CP (Decree 24). Accordingly, in Decree 24, contractors on the list of contractors whose reputation is assessed in participating in bidding will have to provide a bid security measure with a value of 3 times higher when participating in bidding. times the value required for other contractors within 2 years from the last time performing the acts specified in Clause 1, Article 18 of Decree 24.

This function, when deployed, will also provide warnings to contractors on the list when logging in and provide instructions and bid submission notices when contractors participate in bidding but do not meet the conditions for bidding. bid security value.

In addition, the system also allows investors to publicly disclose information on contract performance results and a list of goods used according to Article 17 and Article 18 of Decree 24.

Thus, with changes in the legal corridor, users can feel secure in conducting online bidding on the system thanks to timely updates and upgrades, meeting legal requirements. For any problems during operation, users can refer to the User Guide posted on the system or contact hotline 19006126 for timely answers and support.

(Source: National bidding network system)
